page.title: 04EDUCATION IN ERSKINE
page.content: Due to the increasing population in Erskine six primary schools and one secondary school have been built. The primary schools are Barsail, Bargarran, Rashielea and Inchinnan which are non-denominational and St Anne's and St John Bosco which are Roman Catholic. The primaries are modern open plan schools with the exception of Inchinnan Primary which is a traditional village school. The schools are placed in the main areas of Erskine, three in Park Mains, two in Bargarran, one in North Barr and one in the village of Inchinnan. They are within easy walking distance of the children who attend them. Park Mains High School is a large secondary school which has been built in the centre of Erskine with lots of green areas and playing fields surrounding it.
